1.title: Authenticating API Calls
1.description:
API calls can be authenticated by either providing an API key in the
"X-Api-Key" header or by providing a user access token in the "Authorization"
header.

2.title: Authenticate with API key
2.description: API Keys provide enduring access to a single Centrapay account.

3.title: Authenticate with user access token
3.description: API Keys provide enduring access to a single Centrapay account.

4.title: Authenticate org account with user access token
4.description: API Keys provide enduring access to a single Centrapay account.

5.title: API Keys
5.description: API Keys provide enduring access to a single Centrapay account.

6.title: User Access Tokens
6.description:
User access tokens provide time-limited access to all Centrapay accounts for
which the user is a member. Access tokens are issued using OIDC code flow via
the Centrapay OAuth authorization server and login page at auth.centrapay.com.

7.title: Claims
7.description:
The following table lists the claims which may be be included in a user id token.
At minimum, the "sub" claim and one of "phone_number" or "email" will be present.

8.title: Roles and Permissions
8.description:
Users and API keys are assigned a role for their associated Centrapay
account(s). The permissions granted to the roles are shown in the table below.

9.title: Account Flags
9.description:
Some permissions require an additional flag associated to their individual account or the
targeted account that owns the resource (they may be the same account). For each permission,
if there is a flag associated to it then at least one of them must be met.

12.title: Farmlands Connection
12.description: Farmlands has partnered with Centrapay to deliver new ways for your business to authorise and process Farmlands Card payments that are faster, easier, and more secure than ever.

14.title: Creating Digital Tokens
14.description: Create custom assets that can be exchanged for products or deals.

15.title: Token Collection
15.description: A collection is a grouping of tokens that share the same attributes and redemption conditions, e.g.

16.title: Redemption Conditions
16.description:
A redemption condition allows a Merchant to accept tokens from a token collection.
It contains redemption details specific to that merchant, e.g. redeemable product SKUs.

18.description: Use test assets to make testing integrations easier.

21.description: How to redirect users back to an e-commerce website after paying/cancelling a Centrapay Payment Request.

22.title: Example OIDC Consumer
22.description: How to integrate a browser-based application with the Centrapay OAuth server using an OIDC flow.oidc-client-js) JavaScript library.

23.title: OIDC User Manager Configuration
23.description: Manually trigger a token refresh when expired due to user being offline.

24.title: Minimal OIDC Client Usage
24.description: Manually trigger a token refresh when expired due to user being offline.

25.description: Manually trigger a token refresh when expired due to user being offline.

26.title: Detect OIDC User Refresh
26.description: Detect when OIDC user is refreshed via auto silent renew. The new user may have changed with updated claims, for example, if they have added an email address.

28.title: Farmlands Card Partner Support Guide
28.description: How to for Farmlands Card Partners and Card Holders to request support from the relevant company and teams to get the help they need.

29.title: Support for Portal Users
29.description: Centrapay Platform is unable to process transactions initiated by Card Partners

32.description: Centrapay Platform is unable to process transactions initiated by Card Partners

33.description: Centrapay Platform is unable to process transactions initiated by Card Partners

35.title: P3 - Minor Business Disruption
35.description: Centrapay Platform is operational but suffering performance degradation

36.title: P4 - Adhoc requests as requested by Farmlands
36.description: Adhoc requests as requested by Farmlands

37.title: Farmlands Portal Guide
37.description: Farmlands Co-operative (Farmands) have partnered with Centrapay Payment Gateway (Centrapay) to deliver a secure web portal for Farmlands Card payments.

38.title: Getting Started
38.description: The initial setup of your Business and all Branches (referred to as Merchants) will be managed by Farmlands. Farmlands will provide Centrapay with the details of a primary Account Owner for the business who will be loaded by Centrapay. Once setup this account owner will be able login and maintain the other members (users) who have or need access to the Account (see Members).

39.title: Business Information
39.description: The initial setup of your Business and all Branches (referred to as Merchants) will be managed by Farmlands. Farmlands will provide Centrapay with the details of a primary Account Owner for the business who will be loaded by Centrapay. Once setup this account owner will be able login and maintain the other members (users) who have or need access to the Account (see Members).

40.title: Registration
40.description: Once the Business and Merchants are set up in the Centrapay Portal, users will receive an email from Farmlands inviting them to register for the portal. Users must use the email address provided in the initial setup process to register.

41.title: Log In
41.description: The Centrapay Business Portal will store your authenticated session for up to 60 days. During this time, it is not necessary to re-authenticate simply enter your email address to log in. After 60 days, you will be prompted to re-authenticate by entering a Verification Code sent to your registered email address.

42.title: Dashboard
42.description: The Dashboard is an overview of Centrapay Business Account and will be your main screen for generating an authorisation or releasing a previous Farmlands Authorisation.

43.title: Farmlands Authorisations
43.description: The Centrapay Business Portal provides a real-time authorisation of a Farmlands Card when presented as payment for the purchase of goods or services. It validates that the Card is active and there is a sufficient available balance to process the transaction.

44.title: Authorisation Responses
44.description:
|          Type          |                                                                                                        Description                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Authorisation Approved | Funds have now been placed on hold onto the customer account, pending the receipt of the Card Partner’s invoice within the agreed period.                                                                                  |
| Pending                | Card Partner creates the request, but the authorisation is not yet complete. This authorisation is not approved.                                                                                                           |
| Check ID               | This response may occur for a high-value sale. This means the transaction is pending authorisation until the Card Partner confirms they have authenticated the customer’s photo ID against the name on the Farmlands Card. |
| Declined               | The authorisation is declined due to an invalid card number, a credit limit exceeded, or Card Partner is unable to verify a high-value transaction. Refer to Farmlands Contact Centre 0800 200 600                         |
| Release                | The funds “on hold” are cancelled by Card Partner. This may occur when a Card Partner is unable to fulfil an order. (This is not used for a refund).                                                                       |

45.title: Create a Farmlands Authorisation
45.description: Once an approved authorisation has been provided, a full GST invoice must be submitted to Farmlands at vendor.invoices@farmlands.co.nz. The Short Code shown on the Approval screen must be copied and clearly displayed in the PO field of the invoice or where previously confirmed with the Farmlands Team. The Farmlands 9-digit Card number can be provided in addition to the Short Code in another field. Settlement will be completed as per agreed payment terms.

46.title: Invoicing & Settlement
46.description: Once an approved authorisation has been provided, a full GST invoice must be submitted to Farmlands at vendor.invoices@farmlands.co.nz. The Short Code shown on the Approval screen must be copied and clearly displayed in the PO field of the invoice or where previously confirmed with the Farmlands Team. The Farmlands 9-digit Card number can be provided in addition to the Short Code in another field. Settlement will be completed as per agreed payment terms.

47.title: Releasing Funds
47.description: The Authorised funds will be held against the Cardholder account for 31 days or until the invoice is received.  If the order is cancelled before the invoice is submitted to Farmlands the Authorisation should be released to remove the hold on Cardholder funds.

48.title: Release Hold on Customer Funds
48.description: The Payments page provides a list of transactions that were previously authorised. You can search by using the Authorisation Short Code as the reference. Further search functionality will be available at a later date.

49.title: Authorisation History
49.description: The Payments page provides a list of transactions that were previously authorised. You can search by using the Authorisation Short Code as the reference. Further search functionality will be available at a later date.

50.title: Setting a Default Merchant
50.description: Select your Default Merchant (First-time user) - The default merchant is the branch or outlet that the user normally works from, and which the transaction will be associated with.

51.title: Manage My Centrapay Business Account
51.description: The Account Owner has access to additional options to manage their Centrapay Business Account, including adding an removing users who have access to complete authorisations on their account.

52.title: Merchants
52.description: This area relates to the management of new and existing Branches/Locations used for Centrapay’s other payment types e.g gift cards (i.e not Farmlands). Additional merchants added through the Merchants area will not be able to accept Farmlands Card until they are setup by Farmlands.

53.title: Bank Accounts
53.description: This function is only available to businesses who wish to use other Centrapay supported payment methods other than Farmlands Cards. (e.g. Gift Cards or NZD).

54.title: Members
54.description: On the Members page you can manage the members connected to the Centrapay Business Account. An Account Owner can see the list of members and pending invitations and easily add or remove members.

55.title: Settings
55.description: On the Settings page, you can change your business information. Please note this does not flow through to Farmlands. If you have a change of ownership, please contact Farmlands.

56.title: FAQs
56.description: The Support button opens up a form that will allow you to send a support request directly to Centrapay if you have any issues regarding the Centrapay Business Portal.

57.title: Support
57.description: The Support button opens up a form that will allow you to send a support request directly to Centrapay if you have any issues regarding the Centrapay Business Portal.

58.title: Farmlands POS Integration Guide
58.description: Farmlands has partnered with Centrapay to deliver new ways for your business to authorise and process Farmlands Card payments that are faster, easier, and more secure than ever.

59.title: Centrapay Integration Benefits
59.description: Integrating with Centrapay streamlines the process for authorising and invoicing Farmlands Card Payments. The integration provides:

60.title: Payment Flow Overview
60.description: Farmlands integrations use Centrapay’s Quick Pay Barcode Flow For Merchants to connect to Cardholders and accept Farmlands transactions.

61.title: Payment Flow Implementation
61.description: The Payment Flow can only be used by existing Farmlands Card Partners. Card Partners must complete the following steps to accept Farmlands transactions.

62.title: Merchant Configuration
62.description: Each Card Partner site that needs to accept Farmlands Card payments must be set up as a separate Centrapay Merchant with its own Merchant Config. The Merchant Config contains a Farmlands Payment Option that allows the site to accept Farmlands Payments.

63.title: Authentication
63.description: Requests to Centrapay’s APIs are authenticated by providing an API key in the X-Api-Key header. API Keys provide enduring access to a single Centrapay account.

64.title: Basic Requirements
64.description: The Payment Flow needs the following requirements to be met.

65.title: Payment Conditions
65.description: This extension enables the POS to enforce requiring an ID check for high-risk transactions.

66.title: Pre Auth
66.description: Farmlands Card Partners must support this extension when there is not an invoice number available at the point of sale or the purchase cannot be fulfilled immediately. This might happen if your stock is not on hand or you have a separate fulfilment process.

67.title: Cardholder Not Present
67.description: Farmlands Card Partners must support this extension if they accept payments when the Cardholder is not physically present when a payment is authorised. For example, to accept phone-based orders or orders where the Farmlands barcode is already known.

68.title: Validating Farmlands Barcodes
68.description: Farmlands Card Partners may optionally decode a scanned Farmlands Barcode to confirm that it is valid and apply Farmlands discounts before creating a Payment Request.

69.title: Handling Payment Errors
69.description: The POS must follow Centrapay’s guidelines on handling errors when dealing with inconsistencies in Payment Request statuses due to network issues or race conditions.

70.title: Refunds
70.description: Cardholder purchases are refunded by refunding the Payment Request.

71.title: Short Codes
71.description: Payment Requests have a short code field that is human- and OCR-friendly. When combined with the date or merchant id, short codes can unambiguously identify the correct Payment Request.

72.title: Testing Your Integration
72.description: Merchant Integrators need to work with Farmlands and Centrapay to get set up to test payments. Please contact Farmlands to organise full end-to-end testing.

73.title: Certification Requirements
73.description: For Centrapay to allow integrations to have production assets turned on, we require partners to complete a Certification Process.

75.title: Initiating Refunds
75.description: How to issue refunds on the Centrapay payment platform.

76.title: Refund Idempotency
76.description: Refund requests must provide an externalRef that is unique for all refunds made against the Payment Request.

77.title: Obtaining a Payment Request Id
77.description: Refunds are initiated using the identifier for the Payment Request. However, a patron is NOT expected to have this information available.

78.title: By Short Code
78.description: Call the Get Payment Request by Short Code endpoint using the Centrapay short code that the patron obtains from their paper receipt or digital wallet transaction history.

79.title: By Transaction Reference
79.description: Lookup the transaction within the merchant system using the transaction reference that the patron obtains from their paper receipt or digital wallet transaction history.

80.title: Refund Error Handling
80.description: There are a number of reasons why refunds can fail. These are documented on the Refund Payment Request endpoint and should be communicated to the user.

81.title: Multi-Asset Selection
81.description: Payment Requests may be paid by multiple assets. When refunding a multi-asset Payment Request, the refunded asset is not controllable by the merchant.

82.title: Third-party Asset
82.description: Integrate your assets with Centrapay to unlock the potential to transact with terminals, point-of-sales and merchants already connected with the Centrapay Payments Network.

83.title: Defining a Payment Method
83.description: We require a way of identifying your asset in order to route payments to the correct asset provider. You must define a payment method namespace, description, and list of supported currencies.

84.title: Namespace
84.description: The namespace is a unique string to identify your asset. Your namespace must conform to the following properties:

85.title: Liveness
85.description: The liveness of a payment method can be either main or test. This can be used to accept test assets through Centrapay.

86.title: Description
86.description: Merchants may look at reports or receipts of past transactions. If there was a payment or refund with your asset against their Payment Request, the description of your asset will be displayed.

87.title: Supported Currencies
87.description: Payment Requests have a value determined by the currency a Merchant accepts. You should supply a finite list of three-letter ISO currency codes that is supported by your asset.

88.title: Example Definition
88.description:
| Field                                         | Type   | Description                                                         | Examples          |
| --------------------------------------------- | ------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- |
| Namespace                       | String | A name used for uniquely identifying the asset as a payment method. | centrapay-example |
| Description                   | String | A short human readable description.                                 | Centrapay Money   |
| Supported Currencies | Array  | A list of supported currency codes.                                 | NZD, USD          |

89.title: Uplink API Requirements
89.description: To integrate with Centrapay payments, you must implement the Uplink endpoints. An Uplink is a strategy for performing payment or refund transactions for your Asset. These endpoints will be used in the lifecycle of a payment.

90.title: Contact Details
90.description: Centrapay requires at least one email address to notify you of integration failures or changes. You may choose to provide us with multiple emails for different priorities of communication.

91.title: Protocol
91.description: Each endpoint must use the HTTPS protocol.

92.title: URL
92.description: There are no restrictions regarding the provided URLs, so long as they adhere to the specification for the HTTP method, query parameters, request body, response body, and error codes.

93.title: Authentication
93.description: Endpoints are authenticated against requests using a JSON Web Token (JWT) issued by Centrapay. The JWT will be sent through the Authorization header in the HTTP Request.

94.title: Error Codes
94.description: You may define the errors thrown from each endpoint. If an error is received, Centrapay will get the Transaction Status and decide whether to retry based on the response.

95.title: Settlement
95.description: It is the responsibility of the Asset Integrator to settle funds with a merchant.

96.title: Transaction Idempotency
96.description: An idempotency key is used for HTTP POST requests. Centrapay does not guarantee endpoints will be called only once per transaction. It is expected that you will enforce transaction idempotency. In the event that the idempotency is violated, Centrapay expects a 200 OK response as described in the endpoint specification.

97.title: Uplink API Spec
97.description:
| Name           | Type                                                            | Necessity | Description                                                                                              |
| -------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------- | --------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| currency       | String                                                          | required  | The three letter ISO curreny code for the payment.             |
| amount         | String                                                          | required  | The value required to pay in the smallest denomination for the supported currency (e.g. cents).          |
| authorization  | String                                                          | required  | A reference to the asset of the party paying the Payment Request.                                        |
| merchantName   | String                                                          | required  | The name of the merchant who created the Payment Request.                                                |
| merchantId     | String                                                          | required  | Your identifier for the merchant receiving payment.                                                      |
| idempotencyKey | String                                                          | required  | A unique value that can be used to recognise subsequent retries of the same request.                     |
| transactionId  | String                                                          | required  | An ID for the transaction in Centrapay’s system.                                                         |
| status         | String                                                          | required  | The status of the asset transaction. See possible status values.                            |
| type           | String                                                          | required  | The type of transaction. Possible values are payment or refund.                                          |
| failureReason  | String                                                          | optional  | Required if the status is failed. See possible failure reasons.                      |
| refundable     | Boolean                                                         | optional  | Required if type is payment and status is successful. A flag indicating whether a payment is refundable. |
| refundBefore   | Timestap | optional  | The latest time at which a refund can be initiated.                                                      |

98.title: Transaction Attempt Model
98.description:
| Name           | Type                                                            | Necessity | Description                                                                                              |
| -------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------- | --------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| currency       | String                                                          | required  | The three letter ISO curreny code for the payment.             |
| amount         | String                                                          | required  | The value required to pay in the smallest denomination for the supported currency (e.g. cents).          |
| authorization  | String                                                          | required  | A reference to the asset of the party paying the Payment Request.                                        |
| merchantName   | String                                                          | required  | The name of the merchant who created the Payment Request.                                                |
| merchantId     | String                                                          | required  | Your identifier for the merchant receiving payment.                                                      |
| idempotencyKey | String                                                          | required  | A unique value that can be used to recognise subsequent retries of the same request.                     |
| transactionId  | String                                                          | required  | An ID for the transaction in Centrapay’s system.                                                         |
| status         | String                                                          | required  | The status of the asset transaction. See possible status values.                            |
| type           | String                                                          | required  | The type of transaction. Possible values are payment or refund.                                          |
| failureReason  | String                                                          | optional  | Required if the status is failed. See possible failure reasons.                      |
| refundable     | Boolean                                                         | optional  | Required if type is payment and status is successful. A flag indicating whether a payment is refundable. |
| refundBefore   | Timestap | optional  | The latest time at which a refund can be initiated.                                                      |

99.title: Statuses
99.description:
| Name       | Description                                                                                                                      |
| ---------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| pending    | The transaction is processing.                                                                                                   |
| successful | The transaction has been successfully processed.                                                                                 |
| failed     | The transaction has been unable to be successfully processed. A failure reason is expected to be provided when status is failed. |

100.title: Failure Reasons
100.description: See endpoint spec for possible failure reasons.

101.title: Pay Endpoint
101.description: This endpoint is used to initiate payment. If payment is completed asynchronously, the status will be pending and the get transaction endpoint will be used to poll until the status is successful or failed.

102.title: Refund Endpoint
102.description: This endpoint is used to refund a Payment Request with status paid. Refunds must be synchronous i.e. the status must be successful or failed.

103.title: Cancel Endpoint
103.description: After initiating a transaction with the pay endpoint, the status may be pending. During this time something may have happened to prevent the payment request from being paid (e.g. payment request timeout or merchant network issues).

104.title: Get Transaction Endpoint
104.description: After initiating a payment transaction, the status may be pending. This endpoint will be used to poll the status of the transaction attempt. Polling will continue until either the transaction attempt status is successful or failed, or the Centrapay Payment Request is no longer payable (e.g. it has expired).

105.title: Implementation Checklist
105.description: To enable merchants to accept your asset as a payment method, you must complete an integration certification. When you're ready or need assistance/have questions integrating, please contact the Centrapay Engineering team at integrations@centrapay.com.

106.title: Line Items
106.description: Line items are used to communicate the details of a purchase to a patron.

107.title: Restrictions
107.description:
Payments via Centrapay can be made against specific line items. This can happen because a user has specifically requested the line items they wish an asset to pay for, or because they were using an asset that can only be redeemed for a specific product, like a Centrapay Token.
It's important to communicate to the merchant which line items have been purchased via Centrapay so they are able to make educated decisions when refunding transactions or completing partial payments.
This information should also be displayed to a consumer when possible. If any line items were purchased by a specific asset, they will be returned on a Payment Request inside the Asset Totals array.
Integrators must iterate through the assetTotals array and display any line items purchased to the merchant. Line items that have been purchased via Centrapay must no longer be able to be purchased using another form of payment.
This is especially important for any assets which are only redeemable against specific line items. For example, there could be a case where someone used a digital token to pay for a line item, and then a physical voucher to pay for that same line item, which would mean the second voucher could go towards purchasing something other than the intended line item.

108.title: Determining Paid For Line Items
108.description:
Payments via Centrapay can be made against specific line items. This can happen because a user has specifically requested the line items they wish an asset to pay for, or because they were using an asset that can only be redeemed for a specific product, like a Centrapay Token.
It's important to communicate to the merchant which line items have been purchased via Centrapay so they are able to make educated decisions when refunding transactions or completing partial payments.
This information should also be displayed to a consumer when possible. If any line items were purchased by a specific asset, they will be returned on a Payment Request inside the Asset Totals array.
Integrators must iterate through the assetTotals array and display any line items purchased to the merchant. Line items that have been purchased via Centrapay must no longer be able to be purchased using another form of payment.
This is especially important for any assets which are only redeemable against specific line items. For example, there could be a case where someone used a digital token to pay for a line item, and then a physical voucher to pay for that same line item, which would mean the second voucher could go towards purchasing something other than the intended line item.

109.title: Loading and Sending Assets
109.description: Issue and distribute Centrapay Assets such as Giftcards or Tokens to users via SMS.

110.title: Loading Giftcards
110.description: You can load Giftcards by calling our External Assets endpoint. You will need to use the giftcard number for the externalId field. The pin, the issuer and the type need to be on hand too.

111.title: Sending Assets
111.description: You can send Assets such as Tokens and Giftcards by calling our Asset Transfers endpoint. You will need to have the recipient’s phone number for recipientAlias to identify the reciever.

112.title: Example: Bulk distribution of Giftcards
112.description: Sometimes you might want to load and distribute Giftcards to a large number of recipients. This requires some scripting, but this is not hard. We can do this with:

113.title: Barcode Flow for Merchants
113.description: How merchants can accept payments by scanning a barcode presented by the patron.

114.title: Barcode Flow
114.description: The sequence diagram below indicates the expected flow of behavior between the patron, the Point of Sale (POS) and Centrapay.

115.title: Quick Pay Flow
115.description: Quick Pay is used to immediately confirm the payment without requiring patron approval.

116.title: Checking Barcode Details
116.description: The POS can optionally decode a scanned barcode in order to get further details about a barcode before it creates a Payment Request. For example, the POS can use the barcode provider to apply any provider-specific discounts before creating the Payment Request.

117.title: Merchant Integration Error Handling
117.description: How to deal with inconsistencies in Payment Request statuses due to network issues or race conditions.

118.title: Respect Payment Status
118.description: Use the Payment Request status as the source of truth when determining if a Payment Request is paid or expired. For example, if cancelling a Payment Request fails with a REQUEST_PAID error then the terminal should respond accordingly; either by showing the transaction as paid or initiating a void instead.

119.title: Void Unknown Status
119.description: If the status of a transaction cannot be determined to be successful after retrying, then the Payment Request should be voided. Voiding a Payment Request will cancel the request and trigger any refunds if necessary.

120.title: Configure POS Timeout
120.description: Payment Requests have a configurable timeout which defaults to 2 minutes. Integrators should make sure that the payment terminal times out 5-10 seconds after the Payment Request.

121.title: Retry Unknown Errors
121.description: When faced with an unknown error while checking the status of a Payment Request, POS integrations should retry at least once before voiding the transaction.

122.title: Resolving Persistent Errors
122.description: For issues that cannot be resolved, please reach out to Centrapay Support at integrations@centrapay.com.

123.title: QR Code Flow for Merchants
123.description: How merchants can accept payments by presenting a QR code to the patron.

124.title: Partial Payment
124.description: A core feature of the Payment Request Protocol that allows integrators to accept a partial transaction through Centrapay.

125.title: Partial Payment Flow
125.description:
A patron asks the merchant to process a specified part of the total basket
amount using Centrapay. This could be due to the patron knowing their Centrapay
Asset balance wouldn’t cover the complete basket amount or enable them to use a
set amount of funds from a fixed value asset eg. Gift Card to complete the payment.
Related steps in diagram above: 1→2→3→4→5 or 2→3→4→5→6

126.title: Merchant Driven Scenario
126.description:
A patron asks the merchant to process a specified part of the total basket
amount using Centrapay. This could be due to the patron knowing their Centrapay
Asset balance wouldn’t cover the complete basket amount or enable them to use a
set amount of funds from a fixed value asset eg. Gift Card to complete the payment.
Related steps in diagram above: 1→2→3→4→5 or 2→3→4→5→6

127.title: Patron Driven Scenario
127.description:
A patron using a mobile wallet app may find they lack enough funds to cover the
full payment after connecting to a Centrapay Payment Request. Instead of the
cashier needing to cancel the Payment Request and start over, the patron can
make a partial payment with available funds. Once the Centrapay payment is
successful, the point of sale can take payment for the remaining amount using
another method.Related steps in diagram above: 2→3→4→5→6

128.title: Hybrid Partial Payment Scenario
128.description:
A combination of Merchant and App driven partial payments to cater for edge
cases where needed.Related steps in diagram above: 1→2→3→4→5→6

129.title: Implementation
129.description:
When creating a Payment Request,
opt into partial payment by:

130.title: Creating the Payment Request
130.description:
When creating a Payment Request,
opt into partial payment by:

131.title: Polling for Payment Confirmation
131.description:
Continue to poll the status of the Payment Request until it is no longer new.
If the Payment Request status has been updated to cancelled or expired,
proceed as you normally would. If the status is paid you need to check the
remainingAmount property on the Payment Request.

133.title: Patron Not Present
133.description: Centrapay’s Patron Not Present extension allows a merchant to complete a payment when the patron is not physically present at the time of payment.

134.title: Payment Conditions
134.description: Payment Conditions enable integrations to require conditional approval to accept specific Asset Types as payment.

135.title: Implementation
135.description: In order to support Payment Conditions, the merchant integration must extend Centrapay's payment protocol by creating the Payment Request with the conditionsEnabled flag set to true.

136.title: Additional Behaviors
136.description: The payment request status must always be polled after accepting or declining a condition as these actions may trigger the additional behaviors below.

137.title: Payment Flows
137.description: Centrapay facilitates secure and convenient transactions between customer and merchant devices, with multiple payment flows available for selection. Transact with ease and confidence using Centrapay.

138.title: Merchant-presented
138.description: When a merchant terminal has a customer-facing display it can prompt the customer to pay by showing a QR code.

139.title: Dynamic Merchant QR Code
139.description: When a merchant terminal is neither capable of displaying nor scanning QR codes or barcodes, such as for unattended vending machines, then a static QR code can be used.

140.title: Static Merchant QR Code
140.description: When a merchant terminal is neither capable of displaying nor scanning QR codes or barcodes, such as for unattended vending machines, then a static QR code can be used.

141.title: Patron-presented
141.description: When a merchant terminal is not capable of displaying a customer-facing QR code, then the payment request can be negotiated with the customer by scanning a barcode or QR code displayed on the customer’s smart device.

142.title: Dynamic Patron Barcode
142.description: This is a variant on Dynamic Patron Code. If you’ve setup a long lived Centrapay Enabled Barcode then you can use these to pay on behalf of a Customer. You may need to check a Customer’s Photo ID before this goes through.

143.title: Static Patron Barcode
143.description: This is a variant on Dynamic Patron Code. If you’ve setup a long lived Centrapay Enabled Barcode then you can use these to pay on behalf of a Customer. You may need to check a Customer’s Photo ID before this goes through.

144.title: Quick Pay
144.description: Quick Pay is used to pay the payment request after it is polled for the first time, without requiring patron approval. Quick Pay can only be triggered using the patron-presented flows, and the patron barcode must be linked to an asset type that allows quick pay.

145.title: Payment Terminal
145.description: How to integrate a payment terminal with Centrapay APIs.

146.title: API Keys
146.description: To create API keys, you first need to get in touch with Centrapay to be issued an Integrator Account and an “Account owner” API key. An “Account owner” is a special kind of role that allows you to manage your account.

147.title: Merchant Configs
147.description: Centrapay Merchant Configs represent an available set of configured payment methods that can be utilized by one or more payment terminals by a Merchant.

148.title: Example Flows
148.description: See Payment Flows for an overview of the API calls required for different payment flows.

149.title: Terminal Interface Guidelines
149.description: When configuring a terminal with Centrapay there are a few common touch points that require branded assets. Please use the Centrapay Brand Assets when building the UI for these screens.

150.title: Displaying a Button
150.description: Illustration of payment terminal displaying Centrapay button

151.title: Displaying an Icon
151.description: Illustration of payment terminal displaying Centrapay icon

152.title: Displaying QR Codes
152.description: Illustration of payment terminal displaying Centrapay QR code

153.title: Integration Architecture
153.description: We strongly recommend Centrapay APIs are invoked from your backend and not directly from your payment terminals. Centralizing the invocation of our APIs from your backend offers the following benefits:

154.title: Mitigating Network Issues
154.description: See the guide on Merchant Integration Error Handling for information on preventing and handling network issues.

155.title: Point of Sale
155.description: How to integrate a point of sale (POS) terminal with Centrapay APIs.

156.title: Core Requirements
156.description: Centrapay POS integrations must be able to create, void and refund Payment Requests on behalf of Merchants.

157.title: Optional Protocol Extensions
157.description: Our payment protocol supports several optional extensions. Please review the extensions below and determine which ones you need for your integration.

158.title: Contact Us
158.description: Contact integrations@centrapay.com to get started with API keys.

159.title: Requesting Payment
159.description: How to request payment on the Centrapay payment platform.

160.title: Connecting With Patrons
160.description: The Payment Request object is a core part of Centrapay’s payment protocol. It represents the intention of a merchant to receive payment, defines the amount to be paid, and the acceptable Asset Types for payment.

161.title: Required Fields
161.description: We require compliant integrations to provide the following optional fields when creating a Payment Request.

162.title: Short Codes
162.description: Payment Requests have a short code that is human- and OCR-friendly. Short codes are recycled every two years. When combined with the date or merchant id, short codes can unambiguously identify the correct Payment Request.

163.title: Polling for Payment Confirmation
163.description: After connecting with the patron, the POS must poll the Payment Request status every second until the status has changed.

164.title: Protocol Extensions
164.description: Our payment protocol supports several optional extensions. Please review the extensions below and determine which ones you need for your integration.

165.title: Handling Payment Errors
165.description: Merchant integrations should follow our guidelines in Merchant Integration Error Handling when inconsistencies such as network issues or race conditions occur.

166.title: Requesting Pre Auth
166.description: Centrapay’s Pre Auth extension allows a patron to authorize payment up to a limit when the actual payment amount is not yet known.

167.title: Restrictions
167.description: Pre Auth payments are not supported in all cases.

168.title: Pre Auth Flow
168.description: Pre Auth payments go through an orthogonal payment flow compared to Centrapay’s standard payment flow.

169.title: Authorize
169.description: An authorization is created when the Payment Request is created with the preAuth flag while Requesting Payment.

170.title: Confirm
170.description: Merchants can draw down on authorized funds by making one or more confirmations against an authorized amount. Confirmations must be made with an idempotencyKey in order to prevent merchants from drawing down on authorized funds twice.

171.title: Release
171.description: Authorized funds that have not been confirmed can optionally be released so that the asset holder is granted access to their remaining funds without needing to wait for the authorization to expire.

172.title: Expiry
172.description: Authorizations automatically expire after 3 months. Any unreleased funds are subsequently released to the Patron.

173.title: Refund
173.description: Refunds can be made against authorizations, confirmations, released authorizations and expired authorizations.

174.title: Void
174.description: Voiding a Payment Request will cancel a Payment Request and trigger any refunds necessary. This operation is useful if the POS needs to back out of a transaction due to a network error for example. Voiding can only be used up to 24 hours after the Payment Request was created.

175.title: Paying a Payment Request
175.description: Integrate your app with Centrapay to pay payment requests on merchant terminals and POS

176.title: Overview
176.description:
This guide is for a Third-party Asset Provider to enable paying with their
digital assets with Centrapay.

177.title: Authenticating API calls on behalf of users
177.description:
Third-party applications can make API calls on behalf of users with Centrapay
API keys. All API requests to Centrapay must be made from the integrator’s server.
Centrapay API keys must also be managed server side and stored as secrets to
minimize the risk of API keys being compromised.

178.title: Payment Flow Overview
178.description:
The payment flow below describes how a Third-party Asset Provider should integrate
with the Dynamic Merchant QR Code flow to enable digital payments within their
application. Below is an overview of the process, followed by a more in-depth
look at the integrator’s responsibilities.

179.title: Payment Flow Implementation
179.description:
The user will then scan the QR code from inside the app. Valid Centrapay QR Codes
will have the format https://app.centrapay.com/pay/{paymentRequestId}. Validate
the url by asserting it matches the above format and ignore any malformed QR codes.

180.title: Scan Centrapay QR code
180.description:
The user will then scan the QR code from inside the app. Valid Centrapay QR Codes
will have the format https://app.centrapay.com/pay/{paymentRequestId}. Validate
the url by asserting it matches the above format and ignore any malformed QR codes.

181.title: Get the Payment Request
181.description:
Once the app has validated the url, use the id of the Payment Request to
call the Get Payment Request
API from your server. The returned PaymentRequest model
will provide the details needed to determine if the Payment Request can be completed.

182.title: Pay the Payment Request
182.description:
If the Payment Request is payable with your Asset then you should display the
Payment Request details to the user. Some relevant fields to display are:

183.title: Payment Extensions
183.description:
Extensions to the payment protocol can be used to enhance the user's experience
by providing alternative payment flows.

184.title: Partial Pay
184.description:
If both your app and the merchant support Partial Pay
then you may allow the user to pay only a portion of the Payment Request and
then pay the remaining amount with an alternative payment method.

185.title: Testing
185.description:
Centrapay supports test resources that can be used for integration testing. A test
merchant will be provided that accepts test payments. If you have supplied a
test third-party asset then this merchant can be configured to accept it as a
payment method.

186.title: Transaction Reporting
186.description: Guidelines on communicating the Asset Types used for payment to the user in any transaction reporting function on the merchant side.
